studyMetadata.title: t-SNE Trajectory Visualization Study
studyMetadata.description: A questionnaire study with trajectory visualizations

response.prompt: Gender
Age
Experience with visualizations
Experience with dimensionality reduction

stimulus_1.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which one of the following 3 classes split first from the rest of the classes?
How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_2.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which one of the following 3 classes split first from the rest of the classes?
How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_3.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which one of the following 3 classes split first from the rest of the classes?
How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_4.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which of the following behaviour can you identify within the blue trajectories?
options: They are all generally very similar and only split into smaller subgroups once the main blue group is settled
They seem to be at least two major groups that split early in the optimization
They seem to be at least two major groups that only split late in the optimization

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_5.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which of the following behaviour can you identify within the green trajectories?
options: They are all generally very similar and only split into smaller subgroups once the main green group is settled
They seem to be at least two major groups that split early in the optimization
They seem to be at least two major groups that only split late in the optimization

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_6.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which of the following behaviour can you identify within the pink trajectories?
options: They are all generally very similar and only split into smaller subgroups once the main pink group is settled
They seem to be at least two major groups that split early in the optimization
They seem to be at least two major groups that only split late in the optimization

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_7.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which one of the two matches your observation better?
options: The orange group separates into 2 subgroups and and at least one of the subgroups shares trajectories with the purple group
The orange group and the purple group separate in the first half of the optimization and then move in separate ways while staying relatively close

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_8.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which one of the two matches your observation better?
options: The blue group separates into 2 subgroups and at least one of the subgroups shares trajectories with the orange group
The blue group and the orange group separate in the first half of the optimization and then move in separate ways while staying relatively close

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_9.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which one of the two matches your observation better?
options: The yellow group separates into 2 subgroups and at least one of the subgroups shares trajectories with the blue group
The yellow group and the blue group separate in the first half of the optimization and then move in separate ways while staying relatively close

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_10.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Through the trajectories, can you identify that the yellow group connects the green group and the blue group during most of the time during the optimization?
options: No, but I can identify three visible groups
At least one of the groups is difficult to identify

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_11.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Through the trajectories, can you identify that the green group connects the yellow group and the blue group most of the time during the optimization?
options: No, but I can identify three visible groups
At least one of the groups is difficult to identify

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_12.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which of the following behaviour can you identify among the three groups, assuming there are 2 phases (earlier, later) that equally divide the optimization?
options: They share trajectories before they split at the earlier phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is more related to the blue group than the red group
They share trajectories before they split at the later phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is more related to the blue group than the red group
They share trajectories before they split at the earlier phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is more related to the red group than the blue group
They share trajectories before they split at the later phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is more related to the red group than the blue group

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_13.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which of the following behaviour can you identify among the three groups, assuming there are 2 phases (earlier, later) that equally divide the optimization?
options: They share trajectories before they split at the earlier phase and in the end, the majority of the pink group is more related to the blue group than the orange group
They share trajectories before they split at the later phase and in the end, the majority of the pink group is more related to the blue group than the orange group
They share trajectories before they split at the earlier phase and in the end, the majority of the pink group is more related to the orange group than the blue group
They share trajectories before they split at the later phase and in the end, the majority of the pink group is more related to the orange group than the blue group

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_14.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: Which of the following behaviour can you identify among the three groups, assuming there are 2 phases (earlier, later) that equally divide all iterations
options: They share trajectories before they split at the earlier phase and in the end, the the majority of the orange group is closer to the blue group than the magenta group
They share trajectories before they split at the later phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is closer to the blue group than the magenta group
They share trajectories before they split at the earlier phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is closer to the magenta group than the blue group
They share trajectories before they split at the later phase and in the end, the majority of the orange group is closer to the magenta group than the blue group

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_15.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: The green group
options: connects to blue through the yellow
does not connect to blue at all

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

does not connect to the orange at all

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?

stimulus_18.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_25.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: What can you identify from the green group?
options: There is one main subgroup over the iterations
There are mainly two clear-defined subgroups
There are at least three clear-defined subgroups

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_26.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: What can you identify from the blue group?
options: There is one main subgroup over the iterations
There are mainly two clear-defined subgroups
There are at least three clear-defined subgroups

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

stimulus_27.instruction: Look at the visualization provided and answer the following question:

response.prompt: How do you interpret the relationship between the red and the yellow groups over the iterations?
options: They seem to be closer related compared to many other groups but still distinct
They are very closely related and not well separable
They are fairly distinct in most phases, similar to most other groups

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

response.prompt: How do you interpret the relationship between the blue and the pink group over the iterations?
options: They seem to be closer related compared to many other groups but still distinct
They are very closely related and not well separable
They are fairly distinct in most phases, similar to most other groups

response.prompt: How much confidence do you have in your answer?
How much effort was it to come to the answer?

options: They seem to be closer related compared to many other groups but still distinct
